newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Schering-Plough sees Asia sales up 25-30 pct.
newsitem.headline: Schering-Plough sees Asia sales up 25-30 pct.

text.p: U.S. pharmaceuticals company Schering-Plough said on Friday it saw sales from Asia growing at 25 to 30 percent a year over the next three years from its US$260 million base in 1996.
"We have been growing (in Asia) at 20 to 22 percent in the last two years. We expect to grow 25 to 30 percent a year for the next three years," said executive vice president Raul Cesan.
The Asia-Pacific market for the company includes Australia and South Africa.
Cesan said the market for pharmaceuticals in Asia was growing about 10 percent a year.
Company officials said the Asia market, excluding Japan and China, wais valued at about US$15 billion, of which Schering-Plough's share is about 1.5 percent.
Schering-Plough officials were in Singapore for the official opening of a new pharmaceuticals chemicals plant.
